intro: Scaphochlamys depressa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb with succulent, fleshy leaves that help it retain moisture in dry environments. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in spring. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to anchor itself in sandy or rocky soils. Scaphochlamys depressa is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low precipitation, making it a resilient species in harsh climates.
